pageProps.content:
Experience

Ngorongoro Serena Safari Lodge enjoys a spectacular location on the edge of the world’s largest intact & unflooded caldera – the famous Ngorongoro Crater in Tanzania.
Inspired by cave paintings of Olduvai Gorge, the décor & interiors resemble Africa in every way. Even the lodge exterior is built from natural stone, giving it a cave-like appearance.
Excellent year-round wildlife viewing can be anticipated, as well as historical & cultural tours to nearby Olduvai Gorge or one of the local Maasai villages.

Stay

Ngorongoro Serena Safari Lodge comprises 75 rock-built rooms (including 1 suite) with private stone balconies offering panoramic views overlooking the crater.
Each room is centrally heated & has an en-suite bathroom. The suite is larger than the standard rooms & also includes a sitting area.
The lodge’s main area includes a quirky lounge & bar as well as an open veranda with lush garden views. There is also a beautiful rim-flow swimming pool & small curio shop.

Activities

Guests can enjoy game drives on the crater floor or enjoy hikes & picnics across the Serengeti plains or volcanic mountains of the Crater Highlands.
Other activities include historical tours to Olduvai Gorge & cultural excursions to a local Maasai village.
Post-safari herbal massages can also be booked.

subfolders.title: Entamanu Ngorongoro Camp
subfolders.description: Entamanu Ngorongoro boasts a secluded setting at the edge of the crater’s rim at roughly 3,000 feet above sea level. Tanzania’s Ngorongoro Crater is the country’s most famous landmark & the largest intact volcanic caldera in the world.  And in 2015 it was officially hailed as one of the Seven Natural Wonders of Africa.   At Entamanu, guests can witness the ever-changing landscape of the Serengeti to the west & the Crater to the east.

subfolders.title: Entamanu Private Camp
subfolders.description: Entamanu Private Camp offers an unmatched, exclusive safari experience at the edge of the crater’s rim at roughly 3,000 feet above sea level. Tanzania’s Ngorongoro Crater is the country’s most famous landmark & the largest intact volcanic caldera in the world.  And in 2015 it was officially hailed as one of the Seven Natural Wonders of Africa. The game viewing here is exceptional!  Being one of the most densely populated conservation areas in Africa, with over 25,000 animals residing in the caldera, guests can anticipate seeing the Big 5 as well as a variety of other wildlife.

subfolders.title: Gibb's Farm
subfolders.description: Gibb’s Farm is set on a working farm against the slopes of Tanzania’s Ngorongoro Conservation Area, close to the world’s largest inactive, unbroken & unfilled volcanic caldera: the Ngorongoro Crater. Here guests can experience farm life at its best! With garden-to-table meals & interactive farm affairs like milking the cows, feeding the pigs or joining the farm’s coffee roasters to experience traditional coffee roasting methods – Gibb’s Farm has it all. The farm is an ideal choice for travellers who are looking to combine a traditional safari with a unique experience.

subfolders.title: Kitela Lodge
subfolders.description: Kitela Lodge is set on a hillside in the highlands of the Ngorongoro Crater Area & offers breathtaking views of a coffee plantation & waterfall. Surrounded by majestic mountains, this exclusive retreat is an ideal base from which to explore the region, including the nearby Ngorongoro Crater. The wellness spa & swimming pool offer further relaxation & are the perfect contrast to the daily action-packed safari excursions.

subfolders.title: Lemala Ndutu
subfolders.description: Lemala Ndutu is a mobile tented camp that is set up between November & April each year – during the best wildlife season - & has been described as having the ‘ultimate front row’ seats to the Great Migration. Each year millions of wildebeest, zebra & gazelle migrate in a clockwise direction across the ecosystems of the Serengeti in Tanzania & the Masai Mara in Kenya.   Here at Lemala Ndutu, the views of the southern end of the migration route are so fantastic, you might not even have to get into a 4x4 to witness this world-renowned spectacle.  Occasionally galloping wildebeest & zebra are known to pass right through camp!

subfolders.title: Lemala Ngorongoro
subfolders.description: Set in an ancient acacia forest close to the rim of the magnificent Ngorongoro Crater, Lemala Ngorongoro Tented Camp offers an intimate & secluded safari experience. With easy access to the crater floor, Lemala guests usually have an hour’s head start over others descending the far busier road on the western rim.  This ideal location allows guests early access to the crater – crucial for photographers who demand the best light conditions. Excellent year-round wildlife viewing can be expected as the Ngorongoro Crater is one of the best Big 5 reserves in East Africa.

subfolders.title: Neptune Ngorongoro Luxury Lodge
subfolders.description: Neptune Ngorongoro Luxury Lodge is situated on the edge of the Ngorongoro Conservation Area, a short drive from the game-rich Ngorongoro Crater as well as the rewarding Lake Manyara National Park – famed for its tree-climbing lions. Overlooking a dramatic landscape of volcanic peaks & coffee plantations, Neptune Ngorongoro Luxury Lodge is a tranquil haven for safari-goers in search of superb wildlife viewing & interesting day excursions. The Ngorongoro Crater is known to have the densest concentration of wildlife in Africa & Lake Manyara is home to an abundance of wildlife, so Neptune’s guests will be able to experience the best of both worlds.

subfolders.title: Ngorongoro Crater Lodge
subfolders.description: Ngorongoro Crater Lodge boasts an amazing location on the rim of the world’s largest intact & unflooded caldera – the iconic Ngorongoro Crater. Offering magnificent views over the game-rich crater, the lodge boasts stunning architecture resembling a traditional Maasai mud-&-stick homestead while the interiors & finishes are pure opulence. Ngorongoro Crater Lodge’s guests will not only experience top-notch year-round wildlife viewing – including the famous Big 5 – but will be treated to personal butler service & fine dining, giving the lodge a richly deserved reputation of excellence.

subfolders.title: Ngorongoro Farm House
subfolders.description: Set on a 500-acre coffee farm with glorious views of Oldeani Volcano, Ngorongoro Farm House enjoys an ideal location just 4km from the entrance to the Ngorongoro Conservation Area, close to Lake Eyasi. Ngorongoro Farm House has been designed to reflect an old colonial farm with rustic local materials & Victorian bathtubs. It is a wonderful stop-over between safaris & & offers a variety of exciting safari activities & cultural interactions.

subfolders.title: Ngorongoro Serena Safari Lodge
subfolders.description: Ngorongoro Serena Safari Lodge enjoys a spectacular location on the edge of the world’s largest intact & unflooded caldera – the famous Ngorongoro Crater in Tanzania. Inspired by cave paintings of Olduvai Gorge, the décor & interiors resemble Africa in every way.  Even the lodge exterior is built from natural stone, giving it a cave-like appearance. Excellent year-round wildlife viewing can be anticipated, as well as historical & cultural tours to nearby Olduvai Gorge or one of the local Maasai villages.

subfolders.title: Ngorongoro Sopa Lodge
subfolders.description: Perched on the edge of the Ngorongoro Crater’s highest point, the superb Ngorongoro Sopa Lodge is the only property on the eastern rim of this UNESCO World Heritage Site. The world’s largest intact & unflooded caldera provides a home to a multitude of wildlife, including Africa’s Big 5 – lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo & rhino.   Sopa Lodge has a private road to the crater floor, which means that Sopa guests can avoid the early morning hustle & bustle & reach the crater floor faster than most.

subfolders.title: Sanctuary Ngorongoro Crater Camp
subfolders.description: Sanctuary Ngorongoro Crater Camp is set within the rim valley of the iconic Ngorongoro Crater -   the world’s largest intact & unflooded caldera & a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The crater is home to 30,000 mammals, most of which never leave its protected paradise – ensuring top-notch wildlife viewing year-round.  It is not unusual to see Africa’s Big 5 in a single day as well as a variety of other animals like zebra, eland, jackal & hyena.

subfolders.title: The Highlands Ngorongoro
subfolders.description: The Highlands, an award-winning tented camp, boasts a spectacular setting on the forested slopes of the extinct Olmoti Volcano, surrounded by the Ngorongoro Conservation Area. Offering awe-inspiring views, stylish tents with high-tech facilities & exquisite attention to detail, The Highlands Ngorongoro is quite simply the perfect place from which to discover the wild & pristine Crater Highlands. Discerning travellers with an appetite for luxury will adore the unusual dome-like suites & sweeping views over the distant Serengeti.

subfolders.title: The Manor at Ngorongoro
subfolders.description: The Manor at Ngorongoro, a Cape Dutch style farmhouse, lies within the Shangri-La Arabica Coffee Estate, adjacent to the Ngorongoro Conservation Area in Tanzania. This grand mansion exudes old-world charm & offers guests an exclusive safari experience combining East African hospitality & timeless architecture. The Manor offers 9 cottages that are divided into 2 guest suites, making a total of 18 rooms.  There is also 1 three-bedroom stable cottage for families.  All rooms are beautifully appointed & provide exceptional views of the landscape.
